oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-06-18 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 18, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ferlin Husky (host/performer), guest performer Roy Drusky, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Jimmie Selph, Hank Garland, Minnie Pearl, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1080th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ferlin Husky; Jordanaires; Archie Campbell; Roy Drusky; Tommy Jackson; Jimmie Selph; Hank Garland
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ferlin Husky -- Wings Of A Dove (Ferlin Husky, Jordanaires) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, Ferlin Husky) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Roy Drusky -- Anymore (Roy Drusky, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ferlin Husky) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Tommy Jackson and Jimmie Selph -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Jimmie Selph calls) -- Grant Turner and Ferlin Husky talk -- He'll Understand And Say Well Done (Ferlin Husky, Jordanaires) -- Ferlin Husky introduces Hank Garland -- The Battle Of New Orleans (Hank Garland)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Jackson, Tommy; Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Selph, Jimmy; Campbell, Archie; Minnie Pearl; Husky, Ferlin; Drusky, Roy
